uk.co.caprica.vlcj.player
Class MediaPlayerFactory

java.lang.Object
  uk.co.caprica.vlcj.player.MediaPlayerFactory

public class MediaPlayerFactory
extends java.lang.Object

Factory for media player instances.

The factory initialises a single libvlc instance and uses that to create media player instances.

If required, you can create multiple factory instances each with their own libvlc options.

You should release the factory when your application terminates to properly clean up native resources.

The factory also provides access to the native libvlc Logger and other resources such as the list of audio outputs, and the list of available audio and video filters.

Usage: 

   // Set some options for libvlc
   String[] libvlcArgs = {...add options here...};
 
   // Create a factory instance (once), you can keep a reference to this
   MediaPlayerFactory mediaPlayerFactory = new MediaPlayerFactory(libvlcArgs);
   
   // Create a full-screen strategy
   FullScreenStrategy fullScreenStrategy = new DefaultFullScreenStrategy(mainFrame);
   
   // Create a media player instance
   EmbeddedMediaPlayer mediaPlayer = mediaPlayerFactory.newEmbeddedMediaPlayer(fullScreenStrategy);
 
   // Do some interesting things with the media player, like setting a video surface...
   
   ...
   
   // Release the media player
   mediaPlayer.release();
   
   // Release the factory
   factory.release();

MediaPlayerFactory

public MediaPlayerFactory()
Create a new media player factory.

If you want to enable logging or synchronisation of the native library interface you must use MediaPlayerFactory(LibVlc) and LibVlcFactory.

public MediaPlayerFactory(java.lang.String... libvlcArgs)
Create a new media player factory.

If you want to enable logging or synchronisation of the native library interface you must use MediaPlayerFactory(LibVlc) and LibVlcFactory.

libvlcArgs - initialisation arguments to pass to libvlc

setLogLevel

public void setLogLevel(LogLevel level)
Set the log verbosity level.

The log verbosity level must be set before opening the native log otherwise it will be ignored (at least until the log is closed and then opened again).

Parameters:
level - log level

getAudioOutputs

public java.util.List<AudioOutput> getAudioOutputs()
Get the available audio outputs.

Each audio output has zero or more audio devices, each device having it's own unique identifier that can be used on a media player to set the select the required output device.

Returns:
collection of audio outputs

Returns:
media player instance

newDirectMediaPlayer

public DirectMediaPlayer newDirectMediaPlayer(int width,
                                              int height,
                                              RenderCallback renderCallback)
Create a new direct video rendering media player with a pixel format suitable for, amongst other things, rendering into a BufferedImage.

The pixel format used is "RV32" (a raw RGB format with padded alpha) and the pitch is width*4.

Parameters:
width - width for the video
height - height for the video
renderCallback - call-back to receive the video frame data
Returns:
direct media player implementation

newDirectMediaPlayer

public DirectMediaPlayer newDirectMediaPlayer(java.lang.String format,
                                              int width,
                                              int height,
                                              int pitch,
                                              RenderCallback renderCallback)
Create a new direct video rendering media player.

Parameters:
width - width for the video
height - height for the video
format - pixel format (e.g. RV15, RV16, RV24, RV32, RGBA, YUYV)
pitch - pitch, also known as stride
renderCallback - call-back to receive the video frame data
Returns:
media player instance

newHeadlessMediaPlayer

public HeadlessMediaPlayer newHeadlessMediaPlayer()
Create a new head-less media player.

The head-less player is intended for audio media players or streaming server media players and may spawn a native video player window unless you set proper media options when playing media.

Returns:
media player instance
